data.title: A Broadway Crossroads
data.text: This historical venue was once where the cream of the crop of the Indiana Republican Club held their meetings. artifacts of President Benjamin Harrison, the one-term and 23rd US president (ranked 32 overall), and Indianapolis native can be found in the lobby on the first floor. The Columbia Club hosts many traveling cabaret acts that features some of Broadway's top and noteworthy performers. Indianapolis has served as an interesting crossroads where performers feel welcome to perform and continues to maintain that tradition in great strides today. At the Columbia Club performers are encouraged to let it all out and often they do. Some of the benefits of the intimate cabaret experience. At times the historical ambiance of the club stifles the modern history of the city and the performances there in ways if the production value of the space and experience increased evenings as a whole would be breathtaking. For example, if your intent is to enjoy good food and wine before the performances, I suggest getting a reservation at one of the many nearby restaurants. The wine list is safe to say the least, and while it does not have any offensive offerings, it lacks any remarkable offerings. There is an opportunity lost here I hope can be resolved in time and with a little passion for the space that coincides with the acts that enter its hollowed halls.

data.title: great food.
data.text: We had both breakfast and dinner at this hotel. Nice portions and the desserts can be shared because they are quantity and quality.

data.title: Never received service
data.text: My girlfriend and I tried to eat here while we were staying at the Club. The experience thus far with the booking and parking was atrocious, but we thought we could at least have a good meal. We first tried the bar, and were told to seat ourselves and a server would be with us. After waiting 15 minutes with no service, we decided to go to the restaurant side. We stood at the host's stand for another 5 minutes without being acknowledged. We left and went to Yard House instead, where we received excellent service and food.

data.title: Classic style
data.text: Very good classic style bar with very good brands and top quality food on offer.  Excellent service but not a trendy place, more classic and conservative.

data.title: Private Club
data.text: Great atmosphere and good food but the public cannot just walk in off the street for a meal. No money accepted and people sign for their meals. The ambience is quite nice and the food is very good as they employ a true chef and not a cook.

data.title: Harrison Prime Chop House Review
data.text: We visited during Devour Downtown week as it is a typically a private dining restaurant and club. The food was good but nothing special for the $120 bill. Chocolate stout cake was best part of the meal. It was fun to visit because the decor is really beautiful. Dress is business casual so no jeans. Gratuity is included so even if your waiter is slow with clearing plates or drink refills (like ours), you're still paying 20%.

data.title: Lunch today on the third floor
data.text: Had lunch today on the third floor.  Great food. Gorgeous room. Super service. The whole lunch was good and I heartily recommend it.

data.title: One amazing experience!
data.text: Me and my family went to the Columbia Club for a wedding reception, and it was one of the most gorgeous places I've ever been. The interior was so pretty with crown molding and all types of Greek style of architecture. It truly was a bliss to be in. They parked our car for free, and we felt so welcome into the place. We were greeted with glasses of White Zinfandel wine with all types of snacks to choose from. We then sat in an open dining room with the most beautiful crystal and China you'll ever see. They played the most mellow music too that was very soothing. It was very swanky, and I will be there again when another wedding reception is held there there in my family. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a treat of feeling like royalty every now and then!

data.title: Wedding & Reception
data.text: We were in Indianapolis for a wedding which was held at the Columbia Club. The wedding itself was in a curtained off area off of the entrance and front desk. It was a beautiful setting and the staff of the hotel was very polite and helpful. The reception was held in a banquet room on the top floor. Again, the staff was impeccable. The dinner was superb and the staff did a marvelous job of serving and cleaning up. Since we were guests, I can't speak to value.

data.title: Excellent Food and Service
data.text: Excellent food with various choices!  Excellent service and a nice view. Pretty expensive but would go again.

data.title: Special venue
data.text: We visited this private club for a wedding rehearsal dinner. It is located in the heat of downtown Indianapolis and has a beautiful lobby housing many historic artifacts.The atmosphere, food and service were excellent.

data.title: IMPRESSIVE!
data.text: From the valet to the historical displays to the waitress to the amazing food it would be hard to match this place in Indy. Best oysters & lobster bisque that I've enjoyed at a restaurant. The chef handled specific instructions with excellence for each of the people in our party.

data.title: dinner and a show
data.text: Show was excellent as anticipated.  The seats were first rate.  The meal was excellent and service was polite and attentive.  We were greeted at the entrance and were impressed start to finish.
